posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
What are the Autostill levels based on, slotted level or actual spell level?

I know that when you figure out the DCs, it is the basic spell level that is used rather than the slotted level so metamagic will not increase the DC (or am I wrong about this????)

For example, if my wizard casts Empowered IGMS (in Slot Level 8) with only the Autostill II feat, does it have the standard amount of arcane failure or is it stilled?

As usual, TIA for the free education.

Hip

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content: Just tested: It's the slot level that determines whether a spell is autostilled or not. I tested a wizard with Autostill Spell I & II and had him cast an empowered IGMS while wearing full plate and a tower shield (95% arcane spell failure between the two). It failed nearly every time. No failure casting the non-empowered version.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
That's interesting. So the casting level of the DC for the metamagic component (Empowered) is calculated as a level 6 spell, while AutoStill is treating it as a level 8 spell. Then one could extrapolate the same results for the AutoQuicken & AutoSilent versions as well, I suppose. (No need for further testing on my account, as I was only really interested in the Stilled effects.)

Muchas gracias, MrZork!

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content:
De nada, HipMaestro.

The game seems to make the determination for auto-metamagic based on spell slot level and for DC based on spell level. I have added a note with an example to the NWNWiki metamagic entry to make it a little more clear that it's the spell slot level that matters in determining whether a spell will benefit from an auto-metamagic feat.

posts.content: Another potentially obscure piece of NWN tech knowledge resolved. Well done!
